page.title: 02HOUSING ESTATES, IPSWICH
page.content: Two of the largest Council housing estates in Ipswich can be found in the South-East of the town. RACECOURSE AREA: This is a post-war estate,well planned with a definite road pattern. The roads are planned in a 'wheel pattern'.The local shops are in one of the 'spokes'of the wheel,near to the centre.Most of the houses are terraced, but there are some semi-detached within the area.Like many estates of this size there is a large recreation area nearby. The houses are two storey and made from red brick with a tile roof.With small gardens,front and rear,the estate looks the same throughout.Many of the houses are being renvated (see page 4) The shops generally sell 'local' products and have homes above them.
